Karawaci is a company town built from ground up for Lippo, a giant Indonesian conglomerate with interests in everything from property to banking.  By Indonesian standards it's a near-utopian corporate suburb that looks like a misplaced chunk of
, with spotless, leafy streets devoid of hawkers, corporate towers and golf courses. This town is quite popular among Koreans. 40% of Lippo Karawaci residents are Koreans that work around Tangerang.
Karawaci is to the west of
(at the edge of its sprawl), directly off the
Lippo Karawaci, is located 30 minutes drive from Jakarta.   It is also close to
Beach (about 2.5 hours drive).  It takes 3.5 hours drive to

If you like nature, you can jog or even bike along the pedestrian in the early morning, and it's refreshing because the air is still clean and cooler than Jakarta.
If you like shopping, check the shopping section.
If you like sports, check the facilities of Imperial Aryaduta Country Club (awesome...!!!)
If you like foods & hang out, enjoy yourself in Benton Junction, Coco Walk, etc.
If you prefer to be quiet & relax, have fun in Celebrity Fitness Yoga Classes.

. You've just to name it. Lippo Karawaci has lots of bookstores for you to unwind yourself. From small bookshops such as: Juniper books & Open books (in Supermall Karawaci) to mega bookstores such as: KInokuniya, Gramedia, and Times bookstore. If you're book lovers, you'll love these places!

content=401 Bulevar Jend. Sudirman. A convinient relaxing four-star hotel aimed squarely at business travellers & also families who might enjoy a spot of golf on the side, as well as shopping and medical check-up in Siloam Gleneagles Hospital.
content=1012 Permata Sari, Lippo Karawaci. A budget hostel that provides a safe & homely environment.
